climbs.name: Whale
climbs.fa: Ed Sampson, Kelly Vaught, Frank Bentwood & Susan Peplow

content.description: Start 10 feet right of Jackpot and just left of a big, left-facing corner. Climb the face and corner past a couple bolts to reach an obvious overlap split by a seam. Pull through the overlap (crux) and continue up thin cracks to the top and an anchor.
content.protection: Bolts and an anchor. Optional small gear to reach the first bolt.
content.location: Start 10 feet right of Jackpot and just left of a big, left-facing corner.

content.description: Begin about three feet right of Played at the next line of bolts. Make moves up the steep, initial wall into a right facing corner/groove. Follow the groove and bolts to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Begin about three feet right of Played at the next line of bolts.

content.description: Start about five feet right of The River at an arête with a flake. This arête and flake is just left of an obvious easy crack/corner. Layback up the flake on the arête, then make face moves up and left to a ledge. Climb the short face to the top (as for The River).
content.protection: Carry a few medium sized cams. You'll need some cams and cordelettes to rig a slingshot TR.
content.location: Start about five feet right of The River at an arête with a flake. This arête and flake is just left of an obvious easy crack/corner.

content.description:
On the far right side of the cliff, climb a right-facing corner/crack up to a bulging face with 2 bolts (crux).

There is a 2-bolt belay/rappel anchor at the top.
content.protection: 1/2 to 2 inches, including some medium to large stoppers.
content.location: On the far right side of the cliff.

content.description: This is the leftmost route on the wall and climbs a very thin crack to a ledge and the top. The final face moves are a little sporty.
content.protection: Bring a couple very thin cams or ballnuts and some wires. Cams and cordelettes are needed to rig a slingshot TR.
content.location: Start at the very left edge of the face below a thin, slightly right leaning crack.

content.description: Climb the right side of the pillar past 4 bolts just right of Liquor in the Front. There is an overhang about half way up.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Near the right edge of the cliff, this route climbs the right side of a juggy pillar, about 20 feet right of Lucky 7.

content.description: Start up and right of The Bluff arête at an obvious right facing corner. Climb up the steep, initial corner using knobs, then continue up a runnel to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts and an anchor. Optional small cam to reach the first bolt.
content.location: Start up and right of The Bluff arête at an obvious right facing corner.

climbs.name: Pit Boss
climbs.fa: Kelly Vaught & Frank Bentwood & Greg Epperson

content.description: Start about 20 feet down and right of Aces & Eights. Climb up along a vertical fissure past four bolts and a fixed pin to an anchor.
content.protection: Fixed gear and an anchor.
content.location: Start about 20 feet down and right of Aces & Eights.

content.description: Start as for Lucky 7. Climb up the crack of Lucky 7 to gain a right facing corner and an oak tree. Behind the small oak, climb a steep finger crack on the left wall of the corner to lower angled terrain. Belay from the anchor on Comp.
content.protection: Carry gear to a blue Camalot.
content.location: Start as for Lucky 7 below a short crack that leads to an obvious right facing corner.

content.description: Near the right side of the cliff, climb the left side of a steep pillar with 5 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor. This is the pillar just right of Lucky 7.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Up the left side of a steep buttress near the right sector of the cliff, just right of Lucky 7 and left of Slot Machine.

climbs.name: Lucky 7
climbs.fa: Kelly Vaught, Bob Gaines, and Frank Bentwood, September, 2015

content.description:
This route climbs the steep slab up the narrow pillar just right of The Comp.

Climb up to a short handcrack on the right side of the pillar, then angle left past 5 bolts up the slab to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.

content.description: Begin four feet right of The Gambler (eight feet right of Pit Boss) at a left facing corner. Climb the corner and crack for about 25 feet to reach a right facing corner. Climb the corner as it steepens (bolts) to the top.
content.protection: Carry a couple medium sized cams to supplement the three bolts on the climb. Rappel or lower from the anchor.
content.location: Begin four feet right of The Gambler (eight feet right of Pit Boss) at a left facing corner.

climbs.name: The Gambler
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, John Lauretig & Kenny Rogers

content.description: Begin about four feet right of Pit Boss and four feet left of Jackpot. Climb the grainy face between Pit Boss and Jackpot.
content.protection: TR.
content.location: Begin about four feet right of Pit Boss and four feet left of Jackpot.

content.description: Start just right of The Turn at an obvious crack/corner. This crack/corner is just left of the first bolted route, Busted & Broke. Climb the easy crack/corner to the top.
content.protection: Carry a typical JT rack. Use the Busted & Broke anchor to descend.
content.location: Start just right of The Turn at an obvious crack/corner. This crack/corner is just left of the first bolted route, Busted & Broke.

climbs.name: Double Down
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Kelly Vaught, and Frank Bentwood, September 2015.

content.description:
This is a direct start to Lucky 7.

Begin at the lower left side of the pillar, at an undercling, and  make a few powerful moves past several diagonal cracks, then move right, intersecting Lucky 7 at its second bolt. Finish up Lucky 7.
content.protection: TR from bolt anchor.

content.description: Start to the right of Lucky 7 and Pair of Jacks and just left of Liquor in the Front below an obvious crack/corner. Climb directly up the crack/corner past a ceiling to eventually reach the anchor on Liquor in the Front.
content.protection: Carry gear to a blue Camalot.
content.location: Start to the right of Lucky 7 and Pair of Jacks and just left of Liquor in Front below an obvious crack/corner.

content.description: Start in the same spot as Whale and Card Sharp, below a big, left-facing corner. Climb up the corner about 15 feet then climb cracks on the right wall of the corner until you can ultimately swing right onto the face.
content.protection: Carry a standard JT rack. Fixed anchor.
content.location: Start in the same spot as Whale and Card Sharp, below a big, left-facing corner.

content.description: Start in the same spot as Whale, below a big, left-facing corner. Climb directly up the corner and over a ceiling (crux) to the top.
content.protection: Carry a standard JT rack.
content.location: Start in the same spot as Whale, below a big, left-facing corner.

content.description: Near the left end of the cliff is an obvious, easy, right leaning crack/corner (The Flop). This route climbs the rounded buttress/face just right of that crack/corner past several bolts.
content.protection: Bolts and an anchor.
content.location: Near the left end of the cliff is an obvious, easy, right leaning crack/corner (The Flop). This route climbs the rounded buttress/face just right of that crack/corner.

content.description: Start about eight feet right of Busted & Broke at the base of an arête. Climb the arête to eventually join Played or Busted & Broke.
content.protection: TR from the Busted & Broke anchor with a directional.
content.location: Start about eight feet right of Busted & Broke at the base of an arête.

content.description: Begin about five feet right of Well Played at the next line of bolts. Climb into a right facing corner and make surprisingly difficult stemming moves up the corner past an overlap to the top.
content.protection: Bolts and an anchor.
content.location: Begin about five feet right of Well Played at the next line of bolts.
